definition: common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Da Vinci, Edison, Einstein, and Franklin were all vegetarians.
sentences.chinese: 不过一个共通点就是这些人都是素食主义者。

sentences.english: So what do these countries have in common?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这些国家有什么共通点？

sentences.english: The Results reflected both commonality and uniqueness of the three types of groups.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果显示三种类型团体的共通性与独特性。

sentences.english: The superficial differences in their tragic myths cannot hide their similarities in spirit.
sentences.chinese: 其悲剧神话之表相差异，难掩两者内在精神之共通性。

sentences.english: What they all share is a feeling of confusion, even emptiness.
sentences.chinese: 他们所共通的一点就是迷惑与空虚感。

sentences.english: A common set of workstreams is executed across the phases.
sentences.chinese: 一组共通的工作流跨阶段被执行。

sentences.english: Moreover, proved the resemblance between the phenomenology and ancient philosophy in China.
sentences.chinese: 并通过对比得出现象学与中国古代哲学的共通性。

sentences.english: In truth, there is no necessary common measure between these two judgments.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这两种判断之间不一定存在共通的标准。

sentences.english: What do "NCIS" and "Modern Family" have in common?
sentences.chinese: 《NCIS》和《摩登家庭》有什么共通点吗？

sentences.english: They have different shapes but they have some common characterstics.
sentences.chinese: 它们的形状各不相同但又拥有一些共通点。

sentences.english: Music is relaxing and is also a form of communication.
sentences.chinese: 音乐既可以令人陶冶性情，亦是人类的共通语言。

sentences.english: It's a message Banes and Levy are only to open to.
sentences.chinese: 这个想法是贝恩丝和列维的唯一共通之处。

sentences.english: What these examples both have in common is that they are caused by static electricity.
sentences.chinese: 这两个例子的共通点就是，它们都是因静电所引起的。

sentences.english: What do all of these services have in common?
sentences.chinese: 这些服务的共通之处是什么？

sentences.english: The two issues share the same Chinese name, but have little else in common.
sentences.chinese: 前后两期除了刊名几乎别无共通之处。

sentences.english: What do whiners and questioners have in common?
sentences.chinese: 哀诉者和质问者有什么共通之处呢？

definition: different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
different tunes played with equal skill (idiom)/different methods leading to the same result/different approach but equally satisfactory outcome
dividing line between distinct realms/boundary/field-allocation (in Chinese astrology, the association between celestial regions and corresponding terrestrial realms)
traceable to the same stock (idiom); of a common origin (of trends, ideas etc)
virtually the same/differing only on small points
